unnormalised: Hey everyone, long time no see! So, guess what? Results are finally out! Feeling a mix of excitement and, let’s be real, a little bit of dread. Remember those sleepless nights cramming for the boards? Well, the moment of truth has arrived.
normalised: Hey everyone, long time no see! So, guess what? Results are finally out! Feeling a mix of excitement and, let’s be real, a little bit of dread. Remember those sleepless nights cramming for the boards? Well, the moment of truth has arrived.

unnormalised: First off, let me tell you, the website was a total mess! Refreshing every 5 seconds! Finally, it loaded. My roll number: 1234567890. My friend Priya scored 92% in her 10th boards from Ryan International School. Massive congrats to her!
normalised: First off, let me tell you, the website was a total mess! Refreshing every five seconds! Finally, it loaded. My roll number: one two three four five six seven eight nine zero. My friend Priya scored ninety two percent in her tenth boards from Ryan International School. Massive congrats to her!

unnormalised: Okay, so here's the breakdown. English: 88/100. Not bad, but could've been better. Math: 95/100 – yes! All those hours with the tuition sir paid off. Science: a solid 90/100. Social Studies… well, let’s just say history wasn’t my strong suit. 75/100. Ouch. Overall: 88%. Not bad, right? Definitely good enough to get into a decent college.
normalised: Okay, so here's the breakdown. English: eighty eight divided by one hundred. Not bad, but could've been better. Math: ninety five divided by one hundred – yes! All those hours with the tuition sir paid off. Science: a solid ninety divided by one hundred. Social Studies… well, let’s just say history wasn’t my strong suit. Seventy five divided by one hundred. Ouch. Overall: eighty eight percent. Not bad, right? Definitely good enough to get into a decent college.

unnormalised: My cousin Rakesh managed to score 98% - topping his school, Delhi Public School (DPS)! What a legend! His parents are throwing a huge party, I heard. Good on him, he really deserves it after all that hard work!
normalised: My cousin Rakesh managed to score ninety eight percent - topping his school, D-P-S! What a legend! His parents are throwing a huge party, I heard. Good on him, he really deserves it after all that hard work!

unnormalised: Speaking of colleges, now comes the fun part – applications! I’m eyeing St. Stephen’s College, fingers crossed! Cut-offs are usually crazy high, like 96%+. Gotta aim for the sky, right? I think my score puts me in a decent position to get into most colleges, maybe even with a shot at a top-tier one.
normalised: Speaking of colleges, now comes the fun part – applications! I’m eyeing St. Stephen’s College, fingers crossed! Cut-offs are usually crazy high, like ninety six percent plus. Gotta aim for the sky, right? I think my score puts me in a decent position to get into most colleges, maybe even with a shot at a top-tier one.

unnormalised: I'm prepping for CUET with a target score of 750/800. Wish me luck! Also thinking of doing some online courses to bolster my resume. FreeCodeCamp, here I come! Aiming to master Python before college starts. A girl's gotta have skills!
normalised: I'm prepping for C-U-E-T with a target score of seven hundred and fifty divided by eight hundred. Wish me luck! Also thinking of doing some online courses to bolster my resume. Free Code Camp, here I come! Aiming to master Python before college starts. A girl's gotta have skills!

unnormalised: Anyway, that's my result saga! Wishing everyone all the best with their results and future endeavors! Let me know how you all did in the comments below! And remember, marks aren't everything! It's the experiences and friendships you make along the way that truly matter. Peace out!
normalised: Anyway, that's my result saga! Wishing everyone all the best with their results and future endeavors! Let me know how you all did in the comments below! And remember, marks aren't everything! It's the experiences and friendships you make along the way that truly matter. Peace out!
